result.execSummary:
The defendant Karl L. Fredrickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Deferred Prosecution Agreement - Count 1
The defendant shall not engage in any conduct which would lead an impartial magistrate to find probable cause exists to believe that the defendant has committed a violation of the criminal laws of the United States or the State of Wisconsin or of any ordinances adopting the same.

elements

D.A. John Snider appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Troy Nielsen.
The defendant enters a plea of guilty to Counts 1 and 2.
Pleas accepted by the Court after rights were explained.
Count 1 - The defendant will be subject to the Deferred Prosecution Agreement filed today. Judgment of conviction will be withheld for a period of 18 months pursuant to the DPA.
Count 2 - Defendant found guilty as to this count, sentencing to be set in 18 months.
Count 3 - This count is dismissed and read in.
